<pb n="2"/>
# m
## m: the general council
- the council did not meet yesterday due to the absence of a majority of its members
## m: for the sake of jihād
- news from Gaza that the head of its municipality, Saʿīd Efendi al-Shawī, and 400 heroes followed the call for jihād
## m: exemption from military service
- those working on the Baghdad railway are exempt from military service
## m
in the course of a quarrel between Anīs al-Ḥomṣī and Yūsuf al-Ḥalabī from Bāb Tūmā the former fired a gunshot at the latter and injured a passer-by, Jirjī Luwīs
## m: post office in the Mīdān
- since yesterday, letters and parcels can be collected from a post office in the Mīdān
## m: exile
- the police exiled 50 foreigners and sent them to Beirut to be deported to their home countries
## m
- in the course of firing his arms at the offices of the Agricultural Bank in Damascus, Shākir Efendi from Birecek, killed someone
## m: death at the cafe
- Dīb bin Ghanīm al-Ṣabbān sat at the cafe of al-ʿAmāra and suddenly died
## m: refugees from the prison
- from the 42 prisoners who fled from the prison in the citadel of Damascus, only five have been apprehended.
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

<pb n="1"/>
# inbāʾ dākhiliyya (id)
## id: rain in Mecca
## id: heavy rains in Jidda
<pb n="2"/>
## id: lifting the quarantine
- this week the quarantine has been lifted from the Ḥajj. This year health was much better than in previous years
# in Haifa
*<title level="j">al-Karmil</title>* reported:
- from 27 Dec 1330 onwards all shops and stores must be closed from 7 o'clock onwards with the exception of pharmacies
- people walking in the streets between 7 and 9 o'clock ares supposed to carry candles only
- after 9 o'clock a general curfew is imposed
- everybody who wants to leave his house after this hour needs a permit from the police
...
# m
## m: freedom of movement
- in the post a general order had prohibited any movement without permit
- now a new order re-established freedom of movement for foreigners and non-foreigners
## m: the price of charcoal
the head of the municipality issued the following announcement / report
- the <measureGrp type="official">charcoal is provided on behalf of the baladiyya and the price of a <measure commodity="charcoal" unit="qintar" quantity="1">qinṭār</measure> is <measure commodity="currency" unit="ops" quantity="128">Ps 128</measure></measureGrp>
- the <measureGrp type="official">charcoal of Ṣādiq Efendi Bektaş is sold at a price of <measure commodity="currency" unit="ops" quantity="160">Ps 160</measure> <measure commodity="charcoal" unit="qintar" quantity="1">per qinṭār</measure> and he has a supply of 800 qinṭār</measureGrp>.
- committees have been formed in every neighbourhood (*ḥayy*) for the distribution of the coal and to ensure that nothing is sold above this price
- we hope that wealth people buy from Ṣādiq Efendi and thus allow the poor to benefit from the lower price the municipality can offer
## m: ikhtilāl sharikat al-trām
We have said before and will say again that the tramway and electric lighting company is ignorant and solely focussed on maximising its own profits. Here is a new example:
1.
2. The coaches are over-crowded to the extreme in the morning and the evening and the company does not provide more trains / cars for the rush hour.
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

## m: the society of the municipality
- the society, formed from the administration council and the municipality for establishing the budget for 1331 M, will meet today
## m: the days for municipal meetings
- today, the head of the municipality informed all members about the necessity of their presence at the offices on Tue and Thu for general meetings of the baladiyya

<pb n="1"/>
# Aḥmet Cemal Pasha
<pb n="2"/>
# m
## m: the most important holiday (*al-ʿīd al-akbar*)
by the committee for the Mawlid Nabawī
- celebrations of the mawlid nabawī will take place on the eve of 12 Rab I
- longer text
## m: al-Amīr ʿAlī Pasha
- al-Amīr ʿAlī Pasha al-Ḥusnī, deputy president of the Ottoman senate
## m: revenues of the municipality
- revenues during the five months from the beginning of Āb until today amount to <measure commodity="currency" unit="ops" quantity="884067">Ps 884067</measure>
- revenues during the seven months from the beginning of Ādhār until the end of Tam [but these are only five months as well]: <measure commodity="currency" unit="ops" quantity="591294">Ps 591294</measure>
- total revenues for this year so far: Ps 292772 [how could that be? combining the two numbers results in Ps 1475361]
- we hope for an increase in municipal revenues continuing from the last five years. this is despite the war and the efforts of <persName>Ghālib Bey</persName>, the head of the municipality.
## m: assembly of the municipality
- yest: the society of the municipality (al-jamʿiyya al-baladiyya) gathered yesterday and elected as its president <persName>Ghālib Bey al-Zāliq</persName>, the head of the municipality, and <persName>Amīn Efendi al-Tarazī</persName>, member of the administration council, as second president
## m: power cut and the tramway company
- the tramway and electric lighting company cut power / light off from some quarters on allegations of theft of electricity.
- the vali ordered an end to the power cut already for last Sunday, but nothing happened
- the head of the municipality protested in front of the company against this delay and we hope that power will soon be restored.
## m: the price of postmarks / stamps / seals
- the head of the municipality investigates allegations that some sellers of postmarks charge more than the nominal price. Thus they charge for a postmark of Ps 10, half a mecidiye and a metallik (i.e. Ps 10"10)
- he will punish everyone according to the law
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

## m: beans for the army
the 8th Army needs 100.000 to 200.000 kg beans (faṣūliyya) and the same amount of potatoes, 50.000 kg pickles (khal), and 100.000 kg of *qamr al-dīn* at market prices to be asked from the HQ of this army
- dated: 29 Kān II 1330
- signed: Shafīq, head of the chamber of commerce
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

# maḥalliyya:
## maḥalliyya: broadening of a road
the baladiyya began demolishing some houses in Zuqāq Rāmī leading to the square of the municipality (<placeName>Maydān al-Baladiyya</placeName>, i.e. Marja Square) and to the Mushīriyya in order to broaden that road. Thanks are due to the members of the municipality and particularly its president
## maḥalliyya: station for coaches
the municipality banned all coaches from standing / waiting on the Square of the Municipality. The coach station has been moved to the old Sūq al-Khayl
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

## m: the bitumen (*ḥamr*) issue
- Muqtabas has reported in an earlier number
- the Vali of Syria, Khulūṣī Bey, upon reading a petition from the people (al-ahlīn) quickly appointed a special official to <measureGrp>enforce the price of <measure commodity="bitumen" unit="ratl" quantity="1">a raṭl of bitumen</measure> at <measure commodity="currency" unit="ops" quantity="20">Ps 20</measure> instead of the <measure commodity="currency" unit="ops" quantity="50">Ps 50</measure> called for last Tuesday noon</measureGrp>

- iḥtiyāṭ soldiers older than 40 years will not have to continue their service as mustaḥfiẓ
## m: sentencing of a murderer
- <persName>Ḥasan bin Saʿdī al-Nūrī</persName> has been sentenced to 15 years imprisonment for the murder of <persName>ʿAbd bin Muḥammad Ḥarb</persName>

## id: amnesty from penalty
- a new law was issued decreeing the amnesty from financial penalties of their fathers, and those serving in the army
# m
## the day of nawrūz / new year
on Monday night, 6 Jum I, 9 Ādhār 1331, 2 o'clock and five minutes in Tehran and 1 o'clock and seven minutes in Syria, the sun will enter a new year
## m: arrest of two burglars
- Ilyās Yūsuf Bayṭār entered the house of Yūsuf bin Fāris Janārī in Bāb Sharqī with a special key. He has been arrested
- Ilyās bin Jirjī Ayyūb form Diyarbakir has been arrested for burglarising a number of tools from the "Europeans' Club" in Ṣāliḥiyya

# m
## m: aghnām tax
- a new temporary law was issued on 26 Shub 1330. Arabic translation provided.
## m: execution
- yest morning at 10 o'clock <persName>Yūsuf al-Ḥāyik</persName>, a Maronite monk from the village of Sinn al-Fīl and the workers of Lebanon, was executed by hanging. He had been sentenced by the Dīwān al-ʿUrfī in Beirut for having ... with the president of the French senate.
- he was hung after having been given the sacraments by the head of his religious community
- the newspapers of Beirut published the Arabic translation of a letter of reply from the 4th Army to Yūsuf al-Ḥāyik
## m: release from prison
- <persName>Ilyās Bey al-Muṭrān</persName> has been released from prison after serving his full sentence of two months
## m: in the bathhouse
- gun fight broke out in one of Damascus' bathhouses.

## m: destruction of locusts
- soldiers are deployed in the villages of the kaza Damascus to destroy the locust and until last evening they had collected <measure commodity="locust" unit="t" quantity="1189">1.189.000 kg</measure>.
- last eve: the honourable people of Shāghūr, the Mīdān, and of other quarters left the city to help in this urgent matter and destroy the locusts

<measureGrp when="1915-04-08">

- <measureGrp><measure commodity="wheat" unit="kile" quantity="1">medium quality</measure>: <measure commodity="currency" unit="ops" quantity="45">Ps 45</measure> to <measure commodity="currency" unit="ops" quantity="47.50">47"20</measure></measureGrp>
- <measureGrp><measure commodity="wheat" unit="kile" quantity="1">common quality</measure>: <measure commodity="currency" unit="ops" quantity="40">Ps 40</measure> to <measure commodity="currency" unit="ops" quantity="45">Ps 45</measure> </measureGrp>
</measureGrp>- all merchants (*ʿumūm al-tujjār*) are required to abide by these prices

- all people and millers are required to denounce transgressors to the authorities (municipality)

- further bridges near Hama

# m
## m: the buildings of Damascus
- a commission has been formed for the repair of the city under the presidency of <persName>Khulūṣī Bey</persName>, the vali of Syria. Comprising <persName>Riḍā Pasha al-Rukkābī</persName>, <persName>ʿAzīz Bey al-ʿAẓma</persName>, <persName>Sharīf Bey Ramū</persName>, <persName>Nishʾat Bey</persName>, the inspector of the committee (CUP), <persName>ʿAwnī Bey</persName>, the chief engineer of public works, <persName>Bahā Bey al-Munāstirī</persName>, and <persName>Ismāʿīl Efendi al-Nābulsī</persName>.
- in their first meeting they decided to commence with the quarter of Hālāt, which is home to the butchers etc. and to clean the slaughterhouses, repair the gutters
- second meeting: the lambs to be slaughtered and the tram (not read because of people around me.)
## m:
- report from an inhabitant the quarter of al-Kharrāb concerning the municipal inspector of public health and electric wiring in the quarter. for the sake of public health, he demands changes

- general amnesty for all prisoners who have served two thirds of their sentence on behalf of the Sultan's benevolence
## m: the merchants and the price regulation (*tasʿīr*) of the baladiyya
- Shafīq Bey al-Quawwatlī, head of the chamber of commerce in Damascus and member of the provincial administration council, gathered the merchants of sugar, rice, and other merchants of goods to be weighted (*māl al-qabbānī*) to discuss the pledge to sell all these goods at the prices established by the municipality and to bring their stashes from their warehouses to the points of sale (*sāḥat al-bīʿ*).
- they made the pledge and began to sell their goods <pb n="2"/> at the prices set by the municipality, and observed their own compliance
## m: the locusts and the municipality
- Tue: the municipality issued orders to all inhabitants (kull afrād al-ahlīn) to go out and fight the locusts and threatened those who to not obey this order with severe punishment. Butchers, sellers of vegetables, and bakers are exempt from this order
- some months ago, the municipality of Beirut designed a much better system by obliging everyone to deliver a fixed amount of dead locusts, no matter how they obtained or killed them. If someone had to money to just pay others to do it, this had no effect on the amount of locust destroyed
- the Damascene baladiyya's measures on the other hand destroy business and bring all works to a standstill without ensuring an effective battle against the locust
- hopefully the baladiyya will adopt the Beiruti measures for the sake of fighting the locust and supporting the poor.
## m: tariffs for coaches
- set by the municipality on 25 Ḥaz 1331, signed by "Ghālib"
price (PS) | route / time
-|-
6 | from the Marja (*sāḥat al-baladiyya*) to Bāb Muṣallā until 3 o'clock in the night
12 | from any home to the stations of the Ḥijāz Railway and the Hawrān Railway in the Mīdān
9 | from the square (*al-sāḥa*) [probably Marja] to the two railway stations
4 | from Marja Square to Bāb Tūmā and the ʿAzīziyya barracks in the Mīdān
5 | from Marja Square to al-Qaṣṣāʿ and the English hospital
3"10 | from Marja Square to al-ʿAmāra, al-Shāghūr, Maʾdhanat al-Shaḥm, the barracks, Sūq Sārūjā, al-Qaymariyya, al-Baramka, Jisr al-Abyaḍ, and Ṣāliḥiyya
7 | from Marja Square to al-Akrad
5 | from Marja Square to the Mosque of Ibn ʿArabī
6 | from Marja Square to the end of al-Muhājirīn
7"30 | for every hour except on Fridays and Sundays inside the city
9 | for every hour on Fridays and Sundays
8 | for every hour on rides outside the city except Fridays and Sundays
10 | for every hour outside the city on Fridays and Sundays
12 [or 13] | for tours to Dumar during the day
15 | for tours to Dumar during the night
6 | for tours to al-Rabwa
7"20 | for nightly tours from Baramke and the Aleppo railway to al-ʿAmāra, al-Qaymariyya, Bāb Tūmā, and the house of the customer
9 | for nightly tours from Baramke etc. to Ṣāliḥiyya and the Mīdān

- waiting for a customer for more than half an hour is priced equal to the hourly rates
- penalties:
+ financial penalty of 4/5 mecidiye
+ repeated offences will be punished by a ban from the trade

- the train of Aḥmet Cemal Pasha, commander of the 4th Army and Minister of the Navy, was delayed in Hama on his way to Rayāq from where he wants to go to Ṣawfar. There he wants to meet Khulūṣī Bey, the vali of Syria, with whom he plans to return to Damascus

## m: prices of petrol and charcoal
by Ghālib Bey al-Zāliq, head of the baladiyya
new and lower prices established by the municipality:
- the <measureGrp><measure commodity="petrol" unit="box" quantity="1">box of petrol</measure> costs <measure commodity="currency" unit="ops" quantity="200">Ps 200</measure></measureGrp> and <measureGrp>the <measure commodity="petrol" unit="okka" quantity="1">uqqa</measure> costs <measure commodity="currency" unit="ops" quantity="1.25">5 metalliks in retail</measure></measureGrp>
- the <measureGrp><measure commodity="charcoal" unit="qintar" quantity="1">qinṭār of charcoal</measure> sells at <measure commodity="currency" unit="ops" quantity="250">Ps 250</measure></measureGrp> and <measureGrp>the <measure commodity="charcoal" unit="ratl" quantity="1">raṭl</measure> at <measure commodity="currency" unit="ops" quantity="3">Ps 3</measure> in retail</measureGrp>

# maḥalliyya:
## maḥalliyya: the holy month of Ramadan and the tramway
- the company established special night service: 3 trains to the Mīdān and 5 to al-Muhājirīn. 4 times to the tomb of Ibn ʿArabī
- Vali called on the company to continue tramway services during Ramadan until 7 o'clock (which system?) without interruption.
## maḥalliyya: broadening of a street (jādda)
- the broadening Sancaḳdār Street from the Mosque to the end along which course the tramway drives would earn the baladiyya some gratitude.
## maḥalliyya: ice
on the issue of industrial ice. there are 27 stores in Damascus that sell this ice. <measureGrp>the <measure commodity="ice" unit="ratl" quantity="1">slab of one raṭl of ice</measure> is sold at <measure commodity="currency" unit="ops" quantity="1">4 metalliks</measure></measureGrp>
- on the issue of establishing the exact weight of 1 raṭl of ice

# m
## m: large celebrations
on Thu, large celebrations will be held on the occasion of laying the foundations for the tomb of Fatḥī Bey, Ṣādiq Bey, and Nūrī Bey, the war heroes
1. Thu, 12 TIsh II 1331, at 4 o'clock in the afternoon, the foundation stone will be laid for the tomb of the three aviators [the article does not mention the fact that they were aviators]
2. a sufficient number of soldiers will participate in the ceremony, as will students of the secondary school, the industrial school, and orphans
3. Turkish speeches will be delivered by ʿAbdī Tawfīq Bey, official of the provincial secret service, and the Ottoman editors. Arabic speeches will be delivered by Shaykh ʿAbd al-Qādir Efendi al-Mubārak, professor at the Sulṭaniyya school. After reading a tenth of the Quran, the foundation stone will be laid. Afterwards the military music corps will play a farewell

## m: the holes and the sink holes
the police issued a communique to all policemen in Damascus stating that the baladiyya issued a general ban on opening holes for spilling sewage from houses into the streets that threaten public health. the police is to enforce this measure.
the holes have to be closed and people will be prosecuted under the special article of the Code on Provinces and the Penal Code

# m
## m: large victory!
- large celebrations in Damascus as soon as news of a particular victory broke in the city. All corners of the town were adorned with lights and Ottoman flags, the students of the schools staged large enthusiastic demonstrations (muẓāharāt) led by their musical bands
- many people joined these vast celebrations when news of the major defeat of the British in Iraq broke
## m: sugar and petrol in Damascus
the letters the head of the municipality had sent out received a positive answer from Medina. The merchants of that city will send quantities of sugar and petrol to Damascus in order to help the municipality to break the monopolists that have racketed up the prices

# inbāʾ mukhtalafa
## im: the ṣināʾiʿ school in Beirut
ʿAzmī Bey, Vali of Beirut, reassured the public of the the reopening of the industrial school in Beirut. To this end Farīd Bey was appointed the new director.

# am
## am: the municipality
- <persName>Khalīl Efendi Naḥlāwī</persName> was appointed accountant to the municipality of Damascus
## am: akhdh al-muḍābaṭ
- the police announced to all merchants of cereals and vegetables and any other goods under military administration that the commission to establish the military requisitions will return to estimate their rightful contribution
## am: the reason for congestion and alarm
- the municipality announced that the reason for the long cues in front of the ovens and bakeries and the alarm among the populace is the lining up of those who had kept their wheat in their homes. People and the poor then began to crowd together in the hope to buy bread and the plenty of wheat became known to the public (al-ʿumūm).
- the municipality and the police do nothing [against] those who dare to harass the people and the poor in this manner
- and it remains to those who have hoarded wheat to use and eat it and not further keep it and the stores of those who do not do so should be ceased and shared with the poor
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

## m: bad meat
- the municipality understood from a report of the officials in Bāb al-Muṣallā that the butcher <pb n="2"/> Muṣṭafā Ramaḍān from the quarter of Bāb al-Sarīja slaughtered pregnant sheep and the government physician established that this meat is the cause for the turned stomaches
- municipality decided to charge the butcher with a penalty of 0.4 mecidiye for endangering public health. they also prohibited the slaughtering of pregnant sheep and the sale of their meat

# m
## m: municipal collectors
- due to the expansion of areas under the administration of the municipality, it will employ four new magistrates (jāwush) and 2 new collectors (jabbāt) with <measureGrp><measure commodity="labor" unit="month" quantity="1">a monthly salary</measure> of <measure commodity="currency" unit="ops" quantity="450">Ps 450</measure></measureGrp>. And two collectors on foot with <measureGrp><measure commodity="labor" unit="month" quantity="1">a monthly salary</measure> of <measure commodity="currency" unit="ops" quantity="300">Ps 300</measure></measureGrp>. Those who deem themselves fit for the job shall register with the municipality, collectors need to know how to calculate
## m: workshops of the dyers
- it is well known that the presence of dying workshops among domestic buildings and shops is a danger to public health.
- the municipality had informed all dyers that they have to move their businesses outside the city in accordance with the laws until the middle of Shub R

# m
## m: destruction of the locusts
1. Thanks to god that this year we have seen no new invasion of locusts from Africa, and the remainders of last year have been very few and they have been fought by the people and the farmers
2. they were destroyed when they were not flying between sundown and morning
3. the fight against the eggs has been organised by the authorities and the success is due to the Law on Locusts (*qānūn al-jarād*)
4. the eggs can fought in the following manner:
...
5. the work force must be available for two weeks from the first sighting of locusts
6. if the local population is insufficient to fight the locust according to the law on locusts, it must be supported by military personnel . the necessary orders have been given to the command of the army
## m: apprehension of burglars
## maḥalliyya: death of the assistant doctor
Qusṭanṭīn Efendi Mīlū, the assistant physician, died. A large festive funeral procession was held in which participated files of soldiers, the military physicians and other military personell.
## m: tender for wood
the baladiyya requires some 20.000 cubic meters of wood within 15 days and will pay Ps 60 per cubic meter at 1 Mecidiye = Ps 20.
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

## maḥalliyya:
the Ministry of the Interior announced that Armenian refugees are not exempt from taxes for the state and the municipalities unlike other refugees.
## maḥalliyya: hemp and lettuce
- The baladiyya reiterated the prohibition for loads of hemp (*qanab*) to enter the city before dusk as it makes the streets dirty after the municipality had them cleaned.
- similarly the merchants of lettuce (*khass*) are prohibited to bring lettuce to the city before they have cut away its roots and removed the soil from its leaves. It is prohibited to sell lettuce that has not been thus cleaned
al-Muqtabas: Jarīdat Yawmiyya Siyāsiyya Iqtiṣādiyya Ijtimāʿiyya

Dr. Rushdī Efendi al-ʿAṭṭār, the second municipal doctor, has been promoted to the head of the municipal doctors in Damascus. The third doctor Mīshīl Efendi Shamdī has been promoted to second doctor. He was succeeded by Dāwuf Efendi, municipal doctor from Baalbek.
It was also decided to appoint a fourth municipal doctor with the coming month of March Mālī

- appointed officials for the quarters of Shāghūr, Qaymariyya, ʿAmāra and these areas have been properly cleaned
- necessity to appointed officials for the remaining quarters

## m: attempted burglary
## m: agricultural communiqué:
- from Tawfīq Bey, the deputy of the vali and fiscal consultant of the 4th Army

### 1.
concerning last year's scarcity of cereals in the provinces and districts that form the area of the 4th Army it was decided that the representatives of the army buy grain at just prices (*asʿār ʿādila*) and that the army will protect places that have insufficient grain supplies

### 2.
the buying of grain from the people of Damascus, which is part of the 4th Army's operational area, has been entrusted to <persName>ʿAbd al-Raḥmān Bey Efendi al-Yūsuf</persName>, one of the ashrāf and notables of the city, and to <persName>Mūsā Bey Sursuq</persName>, a merchant from Beirut, <persName>Bishāra Efendi al-Aṣfar</persName>, a merchant from Damascus, <persName>ʿAbdallah Efendi Ḥabbāb</persName>, <persName>Anwar Bey al-Bakrī</persName>, and <persName>Fawzī Bey al-Bakrī</persName>. Those are the only persons people should sell their surplus in grains to at the following prices

### 3.
price lists for the area of Damascus, of Muʿallaqa and Baalbek, and Qunaytra and al-Nabk. All prices are provided in Ps and Cents with the nominal value of the Ottoman Lira £T1 = Ps 100 and Ps 1 = 40 Para
The tables are fascinating in that they provide prices in the old fiscal measure of Ps 1 = 40 Para, as well as metrical values of Ps 1 = 100 centimes

### 4.

Farmers sell their grain to the buyers by the kg. for this purpose the grains must be sorted by type and then measured / weighted. Thus the particular weight of the madd will be established, which will then be used to establish the average weight of the madd. The majority of the grains will then be accounted by this standard madd (*al-madd al-ʿāmma*). The measures will be announced and thus everybody will now the weight of the madd of cereals in kg

### 5.

the price of transport [to the collection points, presumably in the centre of the areas mentioned in the tables] is included in the price of the grain. detailing the arrangement: the buyers can arrange means of transportation and buy directly in the villages. Differences between the buyers and the farmers will be arbitrated by the local authorities.

### 6.

if some farmers do not want to sell their surplus compulsorily to the buyers but prefer to deal directly with the army, they can do so at an advantage of 3/5 of the price difference between the price paid by the army to the wholesale buyers and the price paid by the wholesalers to the farmers

### 7.

tables for the direct sale to the army

### 8.
Nobody but the aforementioned wholesale buyers are authorised to buy surplus grain

### 9.
the army controls all cereals it buys from the people and gives the price to their owners

### 10.
the army enforces the ban on any sales outside this regime. it will prevent any deal aiming to bypass this regime and fight corruption (fasād). it has absolute powers to do so.

### 11.
the army accepts delivery of grains from the farmers to the wholesale buyers and form them to the army only if the *ghurābila* is less then 5 per cent.

### 12.
The army districts have to receive the grain within 48 hours and all complains of transgressions shall be directed to the local [civil] authorities

## m: sick in the streets
- some of the infected and sick [cholera epidemic] are walking in the public streets (*al-shawāriʿ al-ʿāmma*) in Damascus. today we saw two sick people lying in front of the Hotel Mecca (funduq al-makka al-mukarrima) in Sancaḳdār Street surrounded by people staring at them.
- the authorities have the duty to remove these unfortunates from the streets. the head of the municipality and the health officials (*rijāl al-ṣiḥḥa*) are particularly responsible for doing so

## m: municipal warnings
official announcement from the baladiyya
1. All owners of real estate must clean the streets in front of their property
2. Everybody who encounters trash and dirt in the streets and alleys etc. must report this failure of the owners
3. Everybody must sprinkle the street in front of his store or warehouse
4. every seller of food or drinks must keep his wares in glass or iron cases as per the law etc.
5. it is prohibited to drink water from ponds, creeks, and rivers
6. it is prohibited to urinate or defecate in the streets and alleys
7. it is prohibited to sit and sleep in the roads (ṭariqāt)
8. all pedestrians in the suqs are obliged to walk on the right side of the street <pb n="4"/>
9. all transgressions will be prosecuted

# hm
## hm: import of cereals
an order from the province to the municipality:
- those who want to bring cereals into their own houses whether it comes from their own fields or not ...
- a commission for the supervision of cereals has been formed by the province and every owner of fields growing cereals must apply for the necessary documents that prove his production and records the amount of grain the authorities request from him
